snippet: The company said Alan R. Mulally would keep his position until 2014. Mark Fields will become chief operating officer and assume day-to-day responsibility for the business.
abstract: Ford Motor Company says its chief executive Alan R Mulally will keep his position until 2014, but that Mark Fields, head of its Americas division, will become chief operating officer and assume day-to-day responsibility for running business.
lead_paragraph: The company said Alan R. Mulally would keep his position until 2014. Mark Fields will become chief operating officer and assume day-to-day responsibility for the business.

headline.main: Ford Names an Operating Officer Who Is Seen as a Possible New Chief
